instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage no video
threads.message:
Other tech ultrasonic'd this and it worked first try, video ok etc.

Customer came to get it and ofc it's not working.  Found bad <RESISTOR>R8178</RESISTOR> that was keeping <SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL> missing, measured in the Megaohms (and possibly <TRANSISTOR>Q8131</TRANSISTOR>), replaced now get fan spin.  Found traces near SMC chewed through, jumpered them (<RESISTOR>R5193</RESISTOR> Test Point to SMC, and <CHIP>U3710</CHIP>'s Test Point to SMC).  I spent a reasonable amount of time making sure other traces near there were good, seems OK.  Have not lifted SMC, i'm running low on replacements but I will if need be.

No USB activity, though 5v is present.  No Video out through my display port adapter which usually works. No volts on <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL>, no shorts either.  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW</SIGNAL> is 0v. PPBUS on BKL fuse 8.6 blah blah

I've never delved into the logic part of this.  Is there any best practices.  My spi is fresh and beautiful. my SMC was potentially nasty. Possibly i lift and check traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water Damage no video
threads.message:
Always reball SMC when you found corrosion near it.

Check all SPI Bus Termination resistors and their traces.
Do you get <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>?
